clinical_study.brief_title: Repetitive Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation as an Analgesic Treatment in Endometriosis Chronic Pain : Feasibility
clinical_study.official_title: Repetitive Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation as an Analgesic Treatment in Endometriosis Chronic Pain : Feasibility Study

brief_summary.textblock:
Endometriosis is associated with different types of pain (acute, chronic, excess nociception, neuropathic) generated by different mechanisms in the nervous system. The rTMS could provide significant analgesia for refractory endometriosis pain.
The aim of the study is to evaluate the feasibility of transcranial magnetic stimulation (rTMS) for analgesia on chronic refractory endometriosis pain.

detailed_description.textblock: The first step consists of the inclusion of 12 patients followed by the filling by each patient of the RedCap software of five simple numerical scales for 4 weeks . Realization of a brain and medullary MRI to allow neuronavigation. Realization of 5 sessions of rTMS in 5 days during the first week then evaluation (physical examination, questionnaires) in consultation on post-stimulation. Then followed for 28 days in total through self-assessment of pain that will be filled daily on REDCap and last consultation on D28 for further evaluation

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: All participants receive the same intervention throughout the protocol

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients tolerant 5 sessions of stimulation and with no increase in pain
primary_outcome.description: The feasibility of rTMS treatment was defined if 7 patients or more over 12 tolerate the 5 sessions of stimulation showed no increase in pain

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in pain between the mean pain evaluated before inclusion
secondary_outcome.description: thanks to the visual analogue scale traded between 0 and 100
